Union Home Minister Rajnath Singh (right), along with BJP leaders Shanawaz Hussain and Meenakshi Lekhi,addressing the media after the party's national executive meeting in New Delhi on Sunday.— Photo: Shanker Chakravarty

“The Prime Minister said party workers and leaders should become a bridge between the government and the people, and resist any attempts by the opposition to embroil them in unnecessary controversies,” Mr. Rajnath Singh said.

He also unveiled future programmes of the party, including the Prime Minister’s proposed visit to Mhow on April 14 and the plans to celebrate samajik samarasta (social harmony) events between April 14-16.

April 24 is Panchayati Raj day, and the party will, on April 19 and 20 hold Kisan Sabhas in as many gram panchayats as possible to connect with the rural masses. From April 21-24 these programmes of mass contact will culminate in conclaves of panchayat representatives. Mr. Modi will address one in Jamshedpur on April 24. “This will be telecast live,” said Mr. Rajnath Singh.

Mr. Modi also urged party workers to visit all newly electrified villages, 6,500 in all and celebrate “Oorja Utsav.”

The Prime Minister, Mr. Rajnath Singh said, asserted that his government had faced no corruption or even political scandals in its tenure so far.
title: ‘Criticism of nation is not acceptable’
